{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3746149,"name":"FredK","username":"FredK","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/71e660/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-09-23T18:10:02.428Z","cooked":"

We are trying to add numbers to our parts in Onshape this year but are confused on how best to do it. We have tried 2 featurescripts but they only number the parts that haven’t been named. We have been trying to name our parts so they are easier to find, but maybe that is not the way to go. Do most teams name their parts or just assign them numbers based on assembly or part studio or some other divisions? If so, do you automate the numbering with a featurescript or individually number them.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-09-23T18:10:02.428Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":249,"readers_count":248,"score":104.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":506529,"topic_slug":"part-numbering-in-onshape","display_username":"FredK","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31768,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/part-numbering-in-onshape/506529/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3746295,"name":"Jayden","username":"jj_schaf","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jj_schaf/{size}/214783_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-23T20:08:56.179Z","cooked":"

We used the Parametric Part Numbering featurescript, with a SUBSYSTEM-PARTSTUDIO-PARTNUMBER naming convention (ex. MNP-01-01 or ELV-02-28). It’s actually really easy to find parts, and you can use the notes feature for keywords as well.

we use parametric part numbers from abhi’s featurescripts

FredK:

We have tried 2 featurescripts but they only number the parts that haven’t been named.

This is the case with all of the part naming featurescripts I have used. If you don’t manually name things, the featurescripts work well.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-09-24T17:20:38.650Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":162,"readers_count":161,"score":47.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":506529,"topic_slug":"part-numbering-in-onshape","display_username":"Nick.kremer","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19714,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3512AM || Grand Arbiter of Morals"},"post_url":"/t/part-numbering-in-onshape/506529/5","custom_user_title":"3512AM || Grand Arbiter of Morals","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3748998,"name":"Ari Meles-Braverman","username":"AriMB","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arimb/{size}/189989_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-26T19:09:41.531Z","cooked":"

My problem with part numbering FeatureScripts is that if you go back and make changes to the Part Studio you can end up adding a part in the middle of the feature tree and then all of the later parts get renamed. That’s a big problem if you are making changes after parts have started to be manufactured. There’s probably a way to get around this with the Onshape API, but we haven’t had a need to explore it.

We usually just assign part numbers manually. It takes a few minutes, but it’s really not the end of the world.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-09-26T19:09:41.531Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":111,"readers_count":110,"score":72.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":506529,"topic_slug":"part-numbering-in-onshape","display_username":"Ari Meles-Braverman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25012,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/part-numbering-in-onshape/506529/6","custom_user_title":"FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3749004,"name":"Nick.kremer","username":"Nick.kremer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nick.kremer/{size}/174932_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-26T19:43:49.133Z","cooked":"

I’m fairly certain that the order of parts is based on the order in which you select them with the featurescript, not the order of parts in the part studio.

So if you have 2 parts, part 1 and part 2 which you have renamed with the featurescript to DRT-001 and DRT-002, and then you make a new part in the feature tree between part 1 and 2, you now have part 1, part 2 (new part), and part 3 (old part 2). Now if you go to modify the featurescript you can do 1 of 2 things:

  • Add part 2 which should result in it being named DRT-003 with no changes to existing parts
  • Reselect all parts again which results in
    • Part 1 as DRT-001
    • Part 2 as DRT-002
    • Part 3 as DRT-003 (previously DRT-002)

Also note that after selecting with the featurescript you can reorder the selections.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-09-26T19:47:29.076Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":93,"readers_count":92,"score":53.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":506529,"topic_slug":"part-numbering-in-onshape","display_username":"Nick.kremer","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":25012,"username":"AriMB","name":"Ari Meles-Braverman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arimb/{size}/189989_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19714,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3512AM || Grand Arbiter of Morals"},"post_url":"/t/part-numbering-in-onshape/506529/7","custom_user_title":"3512AM || Grand Arbiter of Morals","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3749008,"name":"Ari Meles-Braverman","username":"AriMB","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arimb/{size}/189989_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-26T19:50:40.768Z","cooked":"

Even so, you still have to keep track of the proper order to select the parts. If a body gets deleted and you want to replace it with an equivalent body from a different feature (e.g. you replace an Extrude with a Thicken), you have to edit the selection order to get the right part number.

And if you want to get rid of a part altogether, I’m not sure how the FS would handle that. Do missing references count as part numbers? If not, or if the missing reference is accidentally cleared, you have now changed all of your following part numbers. I don’t remember there may be a way to skip numbers, but then you have to modify the FS to skip the proper number at the proper point.

It just seems like an unnecessary source of issues when it takes two minutes to do it manually.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-09-26T19:50:40.768Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":84,"readers_count":83,"score":46.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":506529,"topic_slug":"part-numbering-in-onshape","display_username":"Ari Meles-Braverman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19714,"username":"Nick.kremer","name":"Nick.kremer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nick.kremer/{size}/174932_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25012,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/part-numbering-in-onshape/506529/8","custom_user_title":"FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3749010,"name":"Isaac Proctor","username":"Isaac-The-Pro","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/isaac-the-pro/{size}/265401_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-26T19:56:10.510Z","cooked":"

To answer OP’s original question, I have never bothered with part numbering. I just make sure to name each part manually, and have never felt the need to move to an automated featurescript to number parts. IMO well-named parts are easier to work with than seemingly arbitrary part numbers.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-09-26T19:56:10.510Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":81,"readers_count":80,"score":106.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":506529,"topic_slug":"part-numbering-in-onshape","display_username":"Isaac Proctor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"Regular","title_is_group":false,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69147,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6352 Scouting/Design Lead"},"post_url":"/t/part-numbering-in-onshape/506529/9","custom_user_title":"6352 Scouting/Design Lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3753243,"name":"","username":"Nyx-2502","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nyx-2502/{size}/262274_2.png","created_at":"2025-10-01T19:52:39.174Z","cooked":"

What my teams does is similar to this format: 25D01. 25 for year, D for drivetrain (I for intake/S for shooter, and so on) and part number. 01 for part 1, 02 for part 2, etc… we also manually rename

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-10-01T19:52:39.174Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":43,"readers_count":42,"score":48.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":506529,"topic_slug":"part-numbering-in-onshape","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69788,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/part-numbering-in-onshape/506529/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3753250,"name":"FredK","username":"FredK","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/71e660/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-10-01T20:00:10.887Z","cooked":"

Thanks. Can you explain what you mean by manually rename?

Im sorry, I should have clarified. I meant that we physically right clicked on the part in the part studio, clicked rename, and then renamed the corresponding part

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-10-01T20:01:46.382Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":40,"readers_count":39,"score":23.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":506529,"topic_slug":"part-numbering-in-onshape","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":31768,"username":"FredK","name":"FredK","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/71e660/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69788,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/part-numbering-in-onshape/506529/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3753254,"name":"Nick Aarestad","username":"cadandcookies","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cadandcookies/{size}/158154_2.png","created_at":"2025-10-01T20:02:18.979Z","cooked":"
FredK:

Do most teams name their parts or just assign them numbers based on assembly or part studio or some other divisions?

We number our parts at the part studio level, following a convention YY-AA-PPP (year-assembly-part), with a revision number added if necessary (YY-AA-PPP-V2).

FredK:

If so, do you automate the numbering with a featurescript or individually number them.

We do not automate this. Sometimes we even skip it. The part number is mostly used to communicate unambiguously when someone else is manufacturing the part. Sometimes the part name and part number will be different, but more often than not we just name the part with the part number.
